# Extendicare HOME NAME Emergency Response Plan## Purpose
The Purpose of this Emergency Response Plan is to assist the individuals at the home with the resources and information they need at their fingertips at the time of the emergency. To utilize this Plan to the full potential will require some setup at the home level.- Tab 3, Emergency Contacts, must be completed and inserted into this binder. - The Business Continuity Plan in Tab 4 and Home Schematics in Tab 6 must also be added. - This plan is to be used in conjunction with your Disaster Recovery Box and should be located at reception and in the nursing station (or wherever makes most sense in the home based on ease of accessibility).## Setup
Once setup, in this plan you will find:- The different risk levels associated with emergencies so that you may categorize the emergency you are in and identify the required communications. - The process for communication with corporate office and the media throughout the emergency. - Information on what to do in the event of the activation of any of the emergency colour codes, including checklists to guide you throughout the emergency.

chunks.text:

- RD
- Hydro/electrical and local emergency numbers

- List of volunteers, their skills and contact information
- Address and contact information for the area of refuge
- Reports, tracking sheets and checklist for use during an emergency. - A list of the IMS titles as well as suggestions of who you may designate these roles to.## Reference
Page 3 of this plan provides reference to tools in Extendicare’s Emergency Planning and Management Manual. These tools are useful for emergency planning and knowledge of what to do after the emergency has ended.

# Tab 4 - During the Emergency## Command Centre
During an emergency, the Front Office is the designated command centre, unless the emergency involves that area; all management of the emergency will occur from the command centre. The Secondary Command Centre is the 1st Floor Nursing Station. The Incident Manager will manage the emergency from the command centre. The command centre contains the grid map of the area. Communication with the emergency scene and the command centre is to be constant, maintained by telephone/walkie-talkie. In the event the facility phones are not working, IMS will use personal cell phones.
chunks.section_title: Tab 4 - During the Emergency## Command Centre

chunks.text:
Communication with the emergency scene and the command centre is to be constant, maintained by telephone/walkie-talkie. In the event the facility phones are not working, IMS will use personal cell phones. 2-way radio communication will commence with the arrival of the Fire Department/EMS/RCMP.## Disaster Box
An emergency box is located in the 1st floor photocopy room and at the 2nd floor nursing station.## Situation Report
The purpose of this report is to:
- Document the time and details of significant events;
- Provide a report to other IMS leaders of significant events to be presented during Emergency Operations Centre meetings; and
- Summarize actions taken before and after the emergency situation.## Incident Tracking Sheet

# Ventilation System## Instruction regarding how to shut down the home's ventilation system in the event of air exclusionInclude photos. Include specific directions, photos, and floor schematics.### Examples:
- Buttons, switches, and electrical panels involved in a Code Gray - Air Exclusion procedure will be marked with the identifier “CG” for easier identification. - There is one key for all breaker panels located.**Note:** The pre-filled information below is for example only; homes must remove the pre-filled information and input the home-specific information.### A/Cs, doors, and windows throughout the building
- All windows, doors, and window A/Cs must be closed/unplugged. - The vents in window A/Cs must also be closed. - Window A/Cs are located at the end of each hall, in the 2nd & 3rd small dining rooms, and during the summer, residents may also have A/Cs in their rooms. - Place wet towels or linens around all window air conditioning units where there are gaps between the units and the window to seal out any external air. - Check all resident rooms.
